<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-COMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/02/bezos-step-q3-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Just Around the Riverbend: A Big Change for Amazon
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jeff Bezos smiling " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzYvamVmZl9iZXpvc19zbWlsaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>picture alliance/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Amazon founder and CEO Jeff Bezos <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/2/22263039/amazon-new-ceo-jeff-bezos-andy-jassy-executive-chair-board-q3-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> that in Q3 of this year, he will transition to executive chairman of the company's board. Amazon Web Services chief Andy Jassy will take the CEO spot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Roll the tape: </strong>Bezos launched Amazon in 1994 and grew it from a humble online bookstore to a sprawling $1.7 trillion empire of which "the everything store" is just one part—Amazon is now a major player in cloud computing, tech products, streaming entertainment, and even physical retail with its purchase of Whole Foods and its cashierless stores. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In a letter to employees, Bezos wrote, "The question I was asked most frequently [in the beginning] was, 'What's the internet?'"</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for Jassy, he's been at Amazon since 1997 and built AWS from a minor offshoot of Amazon's e-comm operations to a cloud computing leader. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Oh and btw, Amazon had a record-smashing Q4</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sales <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/amazon-reports-4q-2020-earnings-results-152012181.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped</a> $100 billion for the first time ever. The company has benefited from the Covid-19 pandemic perhaps more than any other, fueling a 38% spike in 2020 net sales compared to 2019.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But storm clouds are gathering:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The company </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-01/will-amazon-unionize-anti-union-campaign-underway-at-bessemer-alabama-p?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is deploying</a></span><span> its internal PR machine against a high-profile labor organizing effort in its Bessemer, AL, fulfillment center. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And yesterday it agreed to pay $62 million to settle charges around its failure to pay some Amazon Flex drivers their full tips (Amazon Flex = a service that pays people to drive their own vehicles for Amazon delivery). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>household-name tech founders, such as Larry Ellison and Bill Gates, often don't <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/jeff-bezos-steps-down-amazon-ceo-n1256540?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fully remove</a> themselves from their companies when they scoot out of the CEO chair. Bezos wrote in his letter, "this is not about retiring," so it's an open question how involved he'll be after the transition. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD & BEV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/02/uber-buys-alcohol-delivery-startup-drizly-11b?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber Volunteers as DD
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt='A photograph of a red bag with the Drizly logo (a white bear with the word "Drizly" in it" on a wooden table; spilling out of the bar are various bottles of wine, beer, and liquor' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTI1L2RyaXpseS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Drizly</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Uber for alcohol is now the alcohol for Uber. Yesterday, the rideshare and delivery giant <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/uber-buy-alcohol-delivery-service-drizly-1-1-billion-n1256457?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> its acquisition of Boston-based Drizly for $1.1 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's Drizly?</strong> The nine-year-old company is a leading alcohol delivery service. It has partnered with thousands of liquor retailers across 1,400 US cities and <a href="https://www.axios.com/uber-buying-booze-delivery-company-drizly-dbd001d7-e23e-4bf0-9213-1889385536de.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">provides</a> the backend infrastructure for stores to offer delivery services (unlike Uber, it doesn't actually hire the drivers). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Uber will integrate Drizly's service into its Eats app, but keep the Drizly app running as well.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors celebrated with a little extra Bailey's and sent Uber's stock up almost 7%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Uber's food delivery business proved indispensable last year when shutdowns crushed rideshare demand. Uber Eats has expanded to groceries and prescriptions and, now, the alcohol e-commerce market, which ballooned during the pandemic as states relaxed delivery restrictions and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/28/us-liquor-sales-soared-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">liquor sales soared</a>. Drizly's business grew 300% in 2020.  </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CORPORATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/02/recapping-four-corporate-earnings-reports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
All Aboard the Earnings Express
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today's journey through the underworld of corporate America has four stops.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Alphabet: </strong>Google's parent company <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/02/alphabet-googl-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">weathered the pandemic</a> like an Arc'teryx parka, earning a record $56.9 billion in revenue last quarter thanks to meaty ad sales. Google also divulged its cloud business stats for the first time: The unit lost $5.6 billion last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Speaking of losing money...ExxonMobil</strong> recorded its <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/02/business/exxonmobil-loss/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first annual loss</a> since Exxon + Mobil merged in 1999. And it wasn't a "no worries, we'll get 'em next time" kind of loss—the energy company shed $22.4 billion as the pandemic hammered demand for fossil fuels. Last year presented the "most challenging market conditions ExxonMobil has ever experienced," said CEO Darren Woods.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. UPS </strong>posted a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/upss-revenue-jumps-21-on-online-shopping-surge-11612266696?mod=business_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record $24.9 billion</a> in revenue during Q4's e-commerce bonanza, a 21% jump from last year. Fun fact: Amazon paid almost $11.3 billion to UPS last year, representing 13.3% of its total revenue.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">4. Pfizer's </strong>report shows that you can save humanity and get rich while you're doing it. The pharma company said it'll earn <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/02/investing/pfizer-earnings-covid-vaccine/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$15 billion in revenue</a> this year, about one-quarter of its total sales, just from its Covid-19 vaccine.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/02/pete-buttigieg-confirmed-transportation-secretary?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pete's First Order as Transportation Secretary
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of Pete Buttigieg gesturing with his hands and saying "Pretzels for all who want them!"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=372 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QaSNPf9SGf5bi961z1/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='A gif of Pete Buttigieg gesturing with his hands and saying "Pretzels for all who want them!"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QaSNPf9SGf5bi961z1/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Senate <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/senate-confirms-pete-buttigieg-transportation-secretary-n1256506?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed</a> Pete Buttigieg to lead the Department of Transportation. He becomes the first openly gay Cabinet confirmee and, at 39, the youngest Transportation Secretary in history. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Mayor Pete, he led a $21 million "Smart Streets" revitalization of downtown South Bend, IN. As Presidential Candidate Pete, his platform <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2020-12-16/citylab-daily-pete-buttigieg-s-transportation-record-explained?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">included</a> a strategy to eliminate traffic fatalities and a $1 trillion infrastructure plan to expand public transportation and address climate change. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What'll he do as Secretary Pete? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With 55k employees and a ~$90B budget at his disposal, his priority is getting Americans traveling safely on public transportation systems clobbered by the pandemic and <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/hand-with-index-and-middle-fingers-crossed_1f91e.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> getting Amtrak wi-fi to load.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Buttigieg's DOT will also play a central role in President Biden's $2 trillion climate and infrastructure plan, which could involve...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Zero-emission public transit and higher federal fuel economy standards </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Expanding electric vehicle infrastructure </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rebuilding roads and bridges </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Addressing the disproportionate impact of pollution and transit disinvestment on some minority communities </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>By putting climate change and racial equity at the center of its mission, Pete’s DOT could try to shake off some of its traditional "<a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/how-mayor-pete-could-reinvent-the-role-of-transportation-secretary-2020-12?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">backwater agency</a>" reputation, urban policy expert Bruce Katz told Insider.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/02/reddit-seems-mad-one-slice-finance-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Question: What's Wrong With Shrubbery?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="hedge" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JyI4aDKRtknFC/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="hedge" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JyI4aDKRtknFC/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Wednesday, we're going to take a reader-submitted question about business and the economy and do our best to answer it. </em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask your question here</em></a><em>. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">From Jenna in California: </strong>Why are Redditors and other day traders angry at hedge funds? What did they do? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Brew's response:</strong> To begin answering this question, we should first <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/investing/102113/what-are-hedge-funds.asp#aim-and-characteristics-of-hedge-funds?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">define</a> a hedge fund as a type of investment fund that typically employs aggressive strategies to generate positive returns, whether the broader market is up or down (aka "hedging"). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So why are they being targeted? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reason 1.</strong> Hedge funds are (seen as) the new masters of the financial universe. After the 2009 financial crisis, regulators <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-retail-trading-funds-regulation-analy-idUSKBN2A218L?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slapped</a> restrictions on the investment banks that played catastrophically fast and loose with their risk levels. But the "non-bank financial sector" (hedge funds and others) shimmied past those rules and have been able to play with the risky assets that were confiscated from the i-banks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reason 2. </strong>(Some) people don't like short sellers. You could call short selling "profiting from a company's misfortune"—shorts <a href="https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2021/01/reddit-gamestop-share-price-explained-wallstreetbets-melvin-capital.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pay out</a> when a company's share price dips—and many hedge funds have big short positions. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This is one reason why a certain Tesla CEO, who's </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-31/tesla-shorts-sellers-lost-38-billion-in-2020-as-stock-surged?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overcome rabid short selling</a></span><span>, joined the GameStop bandwagon. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>No. 2 is a matter of opinion, but No. 1 could mean tighter regulation. Hedge funds fleeing their shorts caused record market volatility last month, and Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has voiced support for reining in the non-bank financial sector. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hope that helps! And feel free to <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ask more questions here</a>. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some people dig a moat</strong>. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nJust Around the Riverbend: A Big Change for Amazon\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Jeff Bezos smiling \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003epicture alliance/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Amazon founder and CEO Jeff Bezos \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/2/22263039/amazon-new-ceo-jeff-bezos-andy-jassy-executive-chair-board-q3-2021?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e that in Q3 of this year, he will transition to executive chairman of the company's board. Amazon Web Services chief Andy Jassy will take the CEO spot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRoll the tape: \u003c/strong\u003eBezos launched Amazon in 1994 and grew it from a humble online bookstore to a sprawling $1.7 trillion empire of which \"the everything store\" is just one part—Amazon is now a major player in cloud computing, tech products, streaming entertainment, and even physical retail with its purchase of Whole Foods and its cashierless stores. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn a letter to employees, Bezos wrote, \"The question I was asked most frequently [in the beginning] was, 'What's the internet?'\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for Jassy, he's been at Amazon since 1997 and built AWS from a minor offshoot of Amazon's e-comm operations to a cloud computing leader. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOh and btw, Amazon had a record-smashing Q4\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSales \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/amazon-reports-4q-2020-earnings-results-152012181.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped\u003c/a\u003e $100 billion for the first time ever. The company has benefited from the Covid-19 pandemic perhaps more than any other, fueling a 38% spike in 2020 net sales compared to 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut storm clouds are gathering:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe company \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-01/will-amazon-unionize-anti-union-campaign-underway-at-bessemer-alabama-p?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis deploying\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its internal PR machine against a high-profile labor organizing effort in its Bessemer, AL, fulfillment center. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd yesterday it agreed to pay $62 million to settle charges around its failure to pay some Amazon Flex drivers their full tips (Amazon Flex = a service that pays people to drive their own vehicles for Amazon delivery). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ehousehold-name tech founders, such as Larry Ellison and Bill Gates, often don't \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/jeff-bezos-steps-down-amazon-ceo-n1256540?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efully remove\u003c/a\u003e themselves from their companies when they scoot out of the CEO chair. Bezos wrote in his letter, \"this is not about retiring,\" so it's an open question how involved he'll be after the transition. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Yesterday, the rideshare and delivery giant \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/uber-buy-alcohol-delivery-service-drizly-1-1-billion-n1256457?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e its acquisition of Boston-based Drizly for $1.1 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's Drizly?\u003c/strong\u003e The nine-year-old company is a leading alcohol delivery service. It has partnered with thousands of liquor retailers across 1,400 US cities and \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/uber-buying-booze-delivery-company-drizly-dbd001d7-e23e-4bf0-9213-1889385536de.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprovides\u003c/a\u003e the backend infrastructure for stores to offer delivery services (unlike Uber, it doesn't actually hire the drivers). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUber will integrate Drizly's service into its Eats app, but keep the Drizly app running as well.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors celebrated with a little extra Bailey's and sent Uber's stock up almost 7%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eUber's food delivery business proved indispensable last year when shutdowns crushed rideshare demand. Uber Eats has expanded to groceries and prescriptions and, now, the alcohol e-commerce market, which ballooned during the pandemic as states relaxed delivery restrictions and \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/28/us-liquor-sales-soared-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eliquor sales soared\u003c/a\u003e. Drizly's business grew 300% in 2020.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday's journey through the underworld of corporate America has four stops.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Alphabet: \u003c/strong\u003eGoogle's parent company \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/02/alphabet-googl-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eweathered the pandemic\u003c/a\u003e like an Arc'teryx parka, earning a record $56.9 billion in revenue last quarter thanks to meaty ad sales. Google also divulged its cloud business stats for the first time: The unit lost $5.6 billion last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. Speaking of losing money...ExxonMobil\u003c/strong\u003e recorded its \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/02/business/exxonmobil-loss/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst annual loss\u003c/a\u003e since Exxon + Mobil merged in 1999. And it wasn't a \"no worries, we'll get 'em next time\" kind of loss—the energy company shed $22.4 billion as the pandemic hammered demand for fossil fuels. Last year presented the \"most challenging market conditions ExxonMobil has ever experienced,\" said CEO Darren Woods.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. UPS \u003c/strong\u003eposted a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/upss-revenue-jumps-21-on-online-shopping-surge-11612266696?mod=business_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord $24.9 billion\u003c/a\u003e in revenue during Q4's e-commerce bonanza, a 21% jump from last year. Fun fact: Amazon paid almost $11.3 billion to UPS last year, representing 13.3% of its total revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e4. Pfizer's \u003c/strong\u003ereport shows that you can save humanity and get rich while you're doing it. The pharma company said it'll earn \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/02/investing/pfizer-earnings-covid-vaccine/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$15 billion in revenue\u003c/a\u003e this year, about one-quarter of its total sales, just from its width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Senate \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/senate-confirms-pete-buttigieg-transportation-secretary-n1256506?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfirmed\u003c/a\u003e Pete Buttigieg to lead the Department of Transportation. He becomes the first openly gay Cabinet confirmee and, at 39, the youngest Transportation Secretary in history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs Mayor Pete, he led a $21 million \"Smart Streets\" revitalization of downtown South Bend, IN. As Presidential Candidate Pete, his platform \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2020-12-16/citylab-daily-pete-buttigieg-s-transportation-record-explained?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincluded\u003c/a\u003e a strategy to eliminate traffic fatalities and a $1 trillion infrastructure plan to expand public transportation and address climate change. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat'll he do as Secretary Pete? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith 55k employees and a ~$90B budget at his disposal, his priority is getting Americans traveling safely on public transportation systems clobbered by the pandemic and \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/hand-with-index-and-middle-fingers-crossed_1f91e.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e getting Amtrak wi-fi to load.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eButtigieg's DOT will also play a central role in President Biden's $2 trillion climate and infrastructure plan, which could involve...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eZero-emission public transit and higher federal fuel economy standards \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExpanding electric vehicle infrastructure \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRebuilding roads and bridges \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAddressing the disproportionate impact of pollution and transit disinvestment on some minority communities \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBy putting climate change and racial equity at the center of its mission, Pete’s DOT could try to shake off some of its traditional \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-mayor-pete-could-reinvent-the-role-of-transportation-secretary-2020-12?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebackwater agency\u003c/a\u003e\" reputation, urban policy expert Bruce Katz told Insider.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eEvery Wednesday, we're going to take a reader-submitted question about business and the economy and do our best to answer it. \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAsk your question here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrom Jenna in California: \u003c/strong\u003eWhy are Redditors and other day traders angry at hedge funds? What did they do? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Brew's response:\u003c/strong\u003e To begin answering this question, we should first \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/articles/investing/102113/what-are-hedge-funds.asp#aim-and-characteristics-of-hedge-funds?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edefine\u003c/a\u003e a hedge fund as a type of investment fund that typically employs aggressive strategies to generate positive returns, whether the broader market is up or down (aka \"hedging\"). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo why are they being targeted? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReason 1.\u003c/strong\u003e Hedge funds are (seen as) the new masters of the financial universe. After the 2009 financial crisis, regulators \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-retail-trading-funds-regulation-analy-idUSKBN2A218L?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslapped\u003c/a\u003e restrictions on the investment banks that played catastrophically fast and loose with their risk levels. But the \"non-bank financial sector\" (hedge funds and others) shimmied past those rules and have been able to play with the risky assets that were confiscated from the i-banks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReason 2. \u003c/strong\u003e(Some) people don't like short sellers. You could call short selling \"profiting from a company's misfortune\"—shorts \u003ca href=\"https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2021/01/reddit-gamestop-share-price-explained-wallstreetbets-melvin-capital.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epay out\u003c/a\u003e when a company's share price dips—and many hedge funds have big short positions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis is one reason why a certain Tesla CEO, who's \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-31/tesla-shorts-sellers-lost-38-billion-in-2020-as-stock-surged?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eovercome rabid short selling\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, joined the GameStop bandwagon. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eNo. 2 is a matter of opinion, but No. 1 could mean tighter regulation. Hedge funds fleeing their shorts caused record market volatility last month, and Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has voiced support for reining in the non-bank financial sector. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHope that helps! And feel free to \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid
